On Tuesday, January 10, 2012 3:11 PM, mike amundsen wrote:
> Markus:
> ok, =
let me ask you directly, can you imagine any circumstance where
> the diffe=
rences between transclusion (LE) and navigation (LO) "matter"
> in an M2M s=
cenario?=A0mca

Hmm.. honestly I can't come up with any scenario where the =
difference
matters. Let's take an example from the H Factor page [1]:

  LE=
: <img src=3D"http://www.example.org/images/logo" title=3D"company logo" />=


Would the following be any different from a M2M POV? Would it render some=

functionality impossible?

  LO: <a href=3D"http://www.example.org/images/=
logo" title=3D"company
logo">company logo</a>

I don't think so. It's up to=
 the client to look for a URI with an associated
title "company logo" and p=
rocess the resource associated to the found URI
accordingly.


[1] http://a=
mundsen.com/hypermedia/hfactor/


--
Markus Lanthaler
